Class Geometry.Rect

  • java.lang.Object
    • Geometry.Rect
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sprite
    Enclosing class:
    Geometry

    public static class Geometry.Rect
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for rectangles. Provides mathematical tools to transform them and such. Position is stored in doubles to allow for fine movements.
    Author:
    Patrick Thomas

        public Rect(double x,
            double y,
            int h,
            int w)
        Constructor. Takes position and size.
        Parameters:
        x - double, x position
        y - double, y position
        h - int, height
        w - int, width

        public Rect(Geometry.Point a,
            Geometry.Point b)
        Constructor. Takes two points
        Parameters:
        a - Top-left corner of rectangle
        b - Bottom-right corner of rectangle

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(double x,
                 double y)
        Move the rectangle to the components of the point given. Basically a teleport to the position.
        Parameters:
        x - double x component
        y - double y component

      • move

        public void move(Geometry.Point p)
        Move the rectangle to the point given.
        Parameters:
        p - Point

      • push

        public void push(double x,
                 double y)
        Moves rectangle by a delta. Adds values to current position to move. Essentially a move that is local, or relative to this's current position.
        Parameters:
        x - double
        y - double

      • push

        public void push(Geometry.Vector v)
        Moves rectangle by a vector. Adds values to current position to move. Essentially a move that is local, or relative to this's current position.
        Parameters:
        v - Vector

      • get_corners

        public int[][] get_corners()
        Returns the corners of the rect as a 2-deep array of ints. Gives top-left and bottom-right points.
        Returns:
        2-deep array of ints (like {{x1, y1}, {x2, y2}})

      • collide_point

        public boolean collide_point(double x,
                             double y)
        Tests to see if a point is inside of this rectangle.
        Parameters:
        x - double, x position of point
        y - double, y position of point
        Returns:
        boolean, true if colliding, false if not

      • collide_point

        public boolean collide_point(Geometry.Point p)
        Tests to see if a point is inside of this rectangle. Uses an actual point.
        Parameters:
        p - Point
        Returns:
        boolean, true if colliding, false if not

      • collide_rect

        public boolean collide_rect(Geometry.Rect r)
        Tests to see if two rects are overlapping. Uses this rect and another rect.
        Parameters:
        r - Rectangle
        Returns:
        boolean, true if colliding, false if not

      • collide_rect

        public static boolean collide_rect(Geometry.Rect r1,
                                   Geometry.Rect r2)
        Tests to see if two rects are overlapping. Uses two rects.
        Parameters:
        r - Rectangle
        Returns:
        boolean, true if colliding, false if not
